content.title: Penetrating Aortic Ulcer (PAU)
content.description: Ulceration of atherosclerotic plaque penetrating through the internal elastic lamina into the media, part of the acute aortic syndrome spectrum.

pathophysiology.mechanism: Atherosclerotic plaque erosion penetrates into aortic media
pathophysiology.result: Focal outpouching, potential for IMH, dissection, or rupture

content.location: Most common in descending thoracic aorta (90%); less common in abdominal aorta

imaging_features.cta: Focal outpouching with irregular margins, often with associated IMH
imaging_features.distinguishing: Focal (vs diffuse dissection), associated with extensive atheroma

clinical_presentation.symptomatic: Chest or back pain similar to dissection

outcomes.tevar: Good results, lesion is often focal and suitable for stent graft

content.statement: Penetrating Aortic Ulcer (PAU) is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Aortic-Dissection that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
